docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12. -- Exports from the United States to all geographical grand divisions except Europe and Oceania were larger in July last than in July, 1935, the Department of Commerce announced today. Imports from Europe, Northern North...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12. -- Exports from the United States to all geographical grand divisions except Europe and Oceania were larger in July last than in July, 1935, the Department of Commerce announced today. Imports from Europe, Northern North America, Asia and Oceania increased, but those from Southern North America, South America and Africa decreased.

headline.main: OUR EXPORTS ROSE IN JULY OVER 1935; Total Was $179,828,000 and Compared With Year Before at $173,230,000. IMPORTS AT $194,114,000 Figure Last Year Was $176,631,000 -- $1,000,000 Decline in Shipments to France.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Still grave financial and political conditions in Continental Europe accounted for another week of iregularity in the foreign exchanges. There were a few exceptions to this reaction, however, this being notable in the case of sterling and associated...
docs.lead_paragraph: Still grave financial and political conditions in Continental Europe accounted for another week of iregularity in the foreign exchanges. There were a few exceptions to this reaction, however, this being notable in the case of sterling and associated currencies, all of which established new highs for the year.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED SEPT. 12, 1936

docs.snippet: BARCELONA, Spain, Sept. 14. -- Popular tribunals are still busy in all parts of Catalonia and the rest of Eastern Spain.
docs.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain, Sept. 14. -- Popular tribunals are still busy in all parts of Catalonia and the rest of Eastern Spain.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BARCELONA, Spain, Sept. 15. -- The first heavy rainfall since the outbreak of the Spanish revolution slowed up the action yesterday and today on the Saragossa front, where the struggle for Huesca is still the center of interest.
docs.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain, Sept. 15. -- The first heavy rainfall since the outbreak of the Spanish revolution slowed up the action yesterday and today on the Saragossa front, where the struggle for Huesca is still the center of interest.
docs.abstract: Cts of local popular justice created in Huesca area

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BARCELONA, Spain, Sept. 17. -- Leftist tribunals continue to function, five condemned officers having been executed here yesterday. The tribunal aboard the prison ship Uruguay condemned to death a major, a captain and two lieutenants and sentenced...
docs.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain, Sept. 17. -- Leftist tribunals continue to function, five condemned officers having been executed here yesterday. The tribunal aboard the prison ship Uruguay condemned to death a major, a captain and two lieutenants and sentenced one lieutenant to life.
docs.abstract: Leftist tribunals function at Barcelona and Lerida; spy executed at Malaga; German in Villena reptd arrested as spy

headline.main: MORE ARE CONDEMNED BY BARCELONA COURTS; Executions of Rebel Officers and Members of Fascist Group Follow Trials by Leftists.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Sept. 19. -- The French Government, there is ground to believe, is bringing pressure on Professor Gaston Jeze, French adviser to Haile Selassie, to prevent his serving on the Ethiopian delegation to the League of Nations Assembly, opening on...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Sept. 19. -- The French Government, there is ground to believe, is bringing pressure on Professor Gaston Jeze, French adviser to Haile Selassie, to prevent his serving on the Ethiopian delegation to the League of Nations Assembly, opening on Monday.
docs.abstract: French Govt believed exerting pressure to prevent Jeze from serving on delegation; difficulties encountered in obtaining members for credentials com

headline.main: FRENCH ACT ANEW TO CURB ETHIOPIANS; Pressure Put on Dr. Jeze to Keep Him From Advising Them in Assembly, Geneva Hears. MOVE A BLOW TO NEGUS It Would Leave Him at Mercy of Technical Procedure -- World Court Cannot Act on Plea.

byline.original: By CLARENCE K. STREITWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: Destruction of Alcazar Denounced by Brazilians

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The complexion of the trading in the foreign exchange market last week showed no variation from that of its predecessors. Sterling and its associated currencies reached up into new high ground for the year, and beyond, and while the French franc was...
docs.lead_paragraph: The complexion of the trading in the foreign exchange market last week showed no variation from that of its predecessors. Sterling and its associated currencies reached up into new high ground for the year, and beyond, and while the French franc was steady the other gold bloc currencies were irregular.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED SEPT. 19, 1936
